alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...NEARLY STATIONARY SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...NORTHWESTERN ELBERT AND SOUTHWESTERN HART COUNTIES UNTIL 1215 AM EDT... At 1112 PM EDT, A thunderstorm producing heavy rainfall was indicated 11 miles southwest of Hartwell, or over Bowman. This storm was nearly stationary. Other nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms stretched from just south of Carnesville to near Hartwell. Locations to be impacted include... Royston, Bowman, Canon, Franklin Springs, Victoria Bryant State Park, Bowersville, Dewy Rose, Vanna and Nuberg. Very heavy rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
